text: Arthur Ernest "Ernie" Fitzgerald (July 31, 1926 â€“ January 31, 2019) was an American engineer. He was born in Birmingham, Alabama. He was a member of the Senior Executive Service in the United States Air Force. He was well known as a U.S. government whistleblower. In 1968, Fitzgerald reported a $2.3 billion cost overrun in the Lockheed C-5 aircraft program.The Journal of Public Inquiry Spring/Summer 2009 As a result, he was fired by Secretary Melvin Laird under the orders of President Richard Nixon. Fitzgerald died on January 31, 2019 in Falls Church, Virginia, aged 92.https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/obituaries/a-ernest-fitzgerald- pentagon-whistleblower-fired-by-nixon-dies- at-92/2019/02/07/2f3277f4-2afe-11e9-984d-9b8fba003e81_story.html ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Engineers from Alabama Category:Military people from Alabama Category:American political writers Category:Politicians from Birmingham, Alabama Category:Writers from Birmingham, Alabama
title: A. Ernest Fitzgerald
